alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 11:08PM EDT until April 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana... East Fork White River, near Rivervale, at Columbus, near Columbus, and Seymour. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Williams and near Bedford. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, APRIL 02... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Williams. * WHEN...Until Sunday, April 02. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, During the late March 2008 flood, the Bedford Times reported the following County roads still flooded; River Road, entire road; Bartlettsville Road, by the bridge and in the bottoms; Judah-Logan Road, by the bridge; Logan Bottoms, the gravel part; Donica Church Road, between Logan Bottom and the hill; Peerless Road, by Mica Metals; Little Salt Creek Run; Stumphole Bridge Road, near Indiana 450; Huron-Williams Road; Lawrenceport Road; Rivervale Road and Earl Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:38 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 6.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage Monday evening to 10.6 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
